page.title: 05NEW SURGERY IN BOW
page.content: The Bow Practice has been established approximately 100 years and since 1922 there have only been three General Practitioners.It now serves 2,700 patients in a rural area within a 7 mile radius of Bow.A new purpose-built surgery was opened in 1984 providing a more spacious and pleasant environment with facilities to dispense medicines,provide child and maternity care,minor casualty service and liason with Community Health Workers.There is no appointment system but a full-time receptionist is employed and a locum G.P. Dr.Selley, who has been qualified ten years,is a cheerful,caring person, but feels overworked at times by the home visits and approx. 25 patients he sees each day.The busiest time is the winter months and his patients are mainly women,children and O.A.P.s.
